description.value: This CapabilityStatement describes the expected capabilities of an intermediary that conforms to the conventions of the Hybrid / Intermediary Exchange FHIR implementation guide.

documentation.value: When performing the role of Inbound Gateway, the intermediary **SHALL**: 1. Ensure that references to the destination FHIR server contained in FHIR resources returned by the destination (e.g., in the Bundle.entry.fullUrl element) and in HTTP header parameters (e.g., Content-Location) are consistent with the address specified by the originator in the request by confirming that the destination populates these references with its public FHIR service base URL and passing returned resources to the originator unchanged. 1. Implement RESTful behavior according to the FHIR specification. 1. Support the JSON source format. When performing the role of Inbound Gateway or Delegated Function Intermediary, the intermediary **SHOULD**: 1. Support the XML source format.

description.value: The intermediary SHALL implement Transport Layer Security (TLS) for all exchanges covered in this IG. 1. The intermediary MAY implement the [HL7 / UDAP Security for Scalable Registration, Authentication, and Authorization FHIR Implementation Guide](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-udap-security-ig/branches/main/index.html). 1. For general security considerations refer to [FHIR Security and Privacy Considerations](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/secpriv-module.html). 1. For additional security guidance, refer to the [core FHIR Security guidance page](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/security.html).
